intro: Symplocos orogenes, commonly known as the Himalayan wax tree, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its dense, wax-like leaves that give it its common name. The plant typically grows at high altitudes, thriving in cool, moist environments with well-drained soil. Its flowers are small and white, appearing in clusters, and it produces edible berries that are an important food source for various wildlife. Symplocos orogenes plays a significant role in the ecological balance of its native habitats.
